--- FILE: ./workflows/release.yml ---
name: Release

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [closed]
    branches:
      - main

permissions:
  contents: write
  pull-requests: write

jobs:
  release:
    name: Create Release
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    # Only run when PR is merged (not just closed)
    if: github.event.pull_request.merged == true
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
          token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Setup Git
        run: |
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"

      - name: Draft Release
        id: drafter
        uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v6
        with:
          config-name: release-drafter.yml
          publish: false  # Don't publish yet
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Extract version
        id: version
        run: |
          VERSION=$(echo "${{ steps.drafter.outputs.tag_name }}" | sed 's/v//g')
          echo "version=${VERSION}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "tag=${{ steps.drafter.outputs.tag_name }}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "üì¶ Next version: ${{ steps.drafter.outputs.tag_name }}"

      - name: Check if tag exists
        id: check_tag
        run: |
          if git rev-parse "${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo "exists=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "‚ö†Ô∏è Tag ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }} already exists"
          else
            echo "exists=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "‚úì Tag ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }} is new"
          fi

      - name: Update version files
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        run: |
          VERSION="${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}"
          
          # Create or update VERSION file
          echo "${VERSION}" > VERSION
          
          # If you have package.json
          if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
            npm version ${VERSION} --no-git-tag-version --allow-same-version
          fi
          
          # If you have other version files, add them here
          # sed -i "s/version: .*/version: ${VERSION}/" config.yaml
          
          echo "‚úì Updated version files to ${VERSION}"

      - name: Commit version bump
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        id: commit
        run: |
          git add -A
          
          if git diff --staged --quiet; then
            echo "has_changes=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "‚ÑπÔ∏è No version files to commit"
          else
            git commit -m "chore: bump version to ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }} [skip ci]"
            echo "has_changes=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
            echo "‚úì Committed version bump"
          fi

      - name: Create and push tag
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        run: |
          git tag -a "${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}" -m "Release ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}"
          
          # Push commit and tag atomically
          git push origin main
          git push origin "${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}"
          
          echo "‚úì Created and pushed tag ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}"

      - name: Publish Release
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            const release_id = '${{ steps.drafter.outputs.id }}';
            
            await github.rest.repos.updateRelease({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              release_id: release_id,
              draft: false
            });
            
            core.info('‚úì Published release ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}');

      - name: Summary
        if: steps.check_tag.outputs.exists == 'false'
        run: |
          echo "## üöÄ Release Created" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "- **Version:** ${{ steps.version.outputs.tag }}" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "- **Release URL:** ${{ steps.drafter.outputs.html_url }}" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
          echo "- **Merged PR:** #${{ github.event.pull_request.number }}" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
--- FILE: ./workflows/pr-labeler.yml ---
name: PR Labeler

on:
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, reopened]

permissions:
  contents: read
  pull-requests: write

jobs:
  label:
    name: Auto-label PR
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Auto-label based on branch name
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            const branch = context.payload.pull_request.head.ref;
            const labels = [];
            
            // Auto-label based on branch naming convention
            if (branch.startsWith('feature/') || branch.startsWith('feat/')) {
              labels.push('feature', 'minor');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('fix/') || branch.startsWith('bugfix/')) {
              labels.push('bug', 'patch');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('hotfix/')) {
              labels.push('bug', 'patch');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('chore/')) {
              labels.push('chore', 'patch');
            } else if (branch.startsWith('docs/')) {
              labels.push('documentation', 'patch');
            }
            
            // Add labels if any were determined
            if (labels.length > 0) {
              await github.rest.issues.addLabels({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.payload.pull_request.number,
                labels: labels
              });
              
              core.info(`‚úì Added labels: ${labels.join(', ')}`);
            } else {
              core.warning('‚ö†Ô∏è No auto-labels determined. Please add version label (major/minor/patch) manually.');
            }

      - name: Comment on PR
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          script: |
            const branch = context.payload.pull_request.head.ref;
            const body = `
            ## üè∑Ô∏è PR Labels
            
            This PR has been automatically labeled based on the branch name: \`${branch}\`
            
            **Version Impact:**
            - \`major\`: Breaking changes (e.g., v1.0.0 ‚Üí v2.0.0)
            - \`minor\`: New features (e.g., v1.0.0 ‚Üí v1.1.0)
            - \`patch\`: Bug fixes/chores (e.g., v1.0.0 ‚Üí v1.0.1)
            
            If the auto-label is incorrect, please update the labels before merging.
            `;
            
            await github.rest.issues.createComment({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.payload.pull_request.number,
              body: body
            });

--- FILE: ./release-drafter.yml ---
name-template: 'v$RESOLVED_VERSION'
tag-template: 'v$RESOLVED_VERSION'

# Changelog template
change-template: '- $TITLE @$AUTHOR (#$NUMBER)'
change-title-escapes: '\<*_&'

# Categories for organizing changes
categories:
  - title: 'üöÄ Features'
    labels:
      - 'feature'
      - 'enhancement'
  - title: 'üêõ Bug Fixes'
    labels:
      - 'fix'
      - 'bugfix'
      - 'bug'
  - title: 'üìö Documentation'
    labels:
      - 'documentation'
      - 'docs'
  - title: 'üîß Maintenance'
    labels:
      - 'chore'
      - 'dependencies'
      - 'refactor'
  - title: '‚ö° Performance'
    labels:
      - 'performance'
      - 'optimization'

# Exclude certain changes from changelog
exclude-labels:
  - 'skip-changelog'
  - 'duplicate'
  - 'invalid'
  - 'wontfix'

# Semantic versioning resolution
version-resolver:
  major:
    labels:
      - 'major'
      - 'breaking'
      - 'breaking-change'
  minor:
    labels:
      - 'minor'
      - 'feature'
      - 'enhancement'
  patch:
    labels:
      - 'patch'
      - 'fix'
      - 'bugfix'
      - 'bug'
      - 'chore'
      - 'dependencies'
  default: patch

# Release notes template
template: |
  ## What's Changed
  
  $CHANGES
  
  **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/$OWNER/$REPOSITORY/compare/$PREVIOUS_TAG...v$RESOLVED_VERSION
  
  ---
  
  ### Contributors
  $CONTRIBUTORS

# Autolabeler (optional - automatically adds labels based on branch names or file paths)
autolabeler:
  - label: 'feature'
    branch:
      - '/^feature\/.+/'
      - '/^feat\/.+/'
  - label: 'bug'
    branch:
      - '/^fix\/.+/'
      - '/^bugfix\/.+/'
  - label: 'chore'
    branch:
      - '/^chore\/.+/'
  - label: 'documentation'
    files:
      - '*.md'
      - 'docs/*'
